publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 17.5

seg.seg: (Certainly) he sees there through long ages terrible, violent sufferings in hell. You, that do not have (the wish) to see these sufferings ...
(Bestimmt) sieht er dort durch lange Zeiten schreckliche, heftige Leiden in der Hölle.
(Certainly,) over long eras, he sees terrible, harsh sufferings in hell.
hear the law with love [and] with [your] whole self. Look good at the one proclaiming the law, evoke the belief in him. [51d] At one time ... (the Buddha was in the Jeta-)
Höret das Gesetz mit Liebe [und] mit dem ganzen Selbst! Den das Gesetz Vortragenden sehet gut an [rufet] Glauben an ihn hervor!
Listen to the Law with love [and] with [your] entire self! The one proclaiming the Law, regard [him] well [, and] belief in him [you shall] call up!
(vana). It was the son of the Śākyas, Hastaka by name, that had gone from the house to the Buddha. Without (having understood) them ...
(he evaded?) and made up a lie. He denied the decisions taken [saying]: Not I such (conversations?) ...
... (wich er?) aus [und] machte sich eine Lüge zurecht. Er leugnete die gefassten Be-/Entschlüsse ab [mit den Worten]: "Nicht ich solche (Gespräche?) ..."
... (he talked?) around [it] [and] prepared a lie for himself. He disclaimed the decisions made [saying]: "Not I such (conversations?) ..."
... the virtuous Śākyas, (having forgotten) themselves, spoke lies. (Should we) not, because of their lie, renounce ...
(All monks, however), that went on their almsround, heard the Tīrthas’ talk [and] reported it to the Buddha. He summoned Hastaka ...
[53d] Hastaka said: I say [so], o shelter and refuge, the Tīrthas shall (not) prevail in this matter. Therefore I do not tell (a lie). The Omniscient (reprimanded) ...
... the ragged clothes ... the one desiring extinction (my not tell) a lie. For he will eat carrion (?) ....
[54d] He takes the splendor from the teaching, (he does not) lead the community to fame, and increases even more the speaking (of blame) ...
the (monkish) virtues. If the monk (having gone) from the house for the sake of the truth loves the lying word, much (and) without (measure) ...
... to be, he gives others the way. [55d] [A] good word one shall utter, never shall an evil word be uttered ....
[is] true, an evil word, once from the mouth (released), brings torture. This strophe he proclaimed to him ....
... (Therefore) the one who has not practiced [moral conduct] must practice it. You also must in every manner turn always from the lie. [56d] ...
... together with the group. May another man rise early, may he rub [his] body with ashes, (may he) day (and night) ...
Mag ein anderer Mensch täglich schon früh aufstehen, mag er [sich] mit Asche den Körper abreiben, ...
May another man get up early in the morning every day, may he rub [his] body down with ashes, ...
... (without) sacrifice I went over from evil [57c] [and] led the way to the Brahma-world. On the almsround the master went, the Omniscient ... [57d] ...
... (ohne) Opfer wurde ich von dem Übel erlöst [und] führte mich(?) [ging(?)] den Weg zur Brahmawelt.
... (without) sacrifice I was released from evil [and] led myself(?) [went(?) the way to the brahma-world.

... (And an evil word, even when released), one shall (not) utter again, the one releasing [it] is bound [thereby], since the noble ones do not utter it thus [in the thought:] it will be released by fools ...
It will have been uttered by fools. (cf : ii, 32)

(Und) [ein böses Wort], auch wenn [es] entlassen wurde, soll man (nicht) wieder von sich geben; der es Entlassende wird [dadurch] gebunden, denn die Edlen geben [es] nicht so von sich [in dem Gedanken]: "Es wird von Toren entlassen sein ...".

(And) [an evil] word, even when [it] has been released, one shall [no] more utter; the one releasing it is [thereby] bound, for the noble ones do not utter [it] in this way [thinking]: "It will be released by fools...".

p.note: Includes strophes 51b-58b of the Vācāvarga (VIII) in a 4x25 syllable-metre (rhythm: 5/5/8/7). In b3-4 and b8, Uv 8.8-8.9 are translated.

The glass cover of the manuscript is broken and thus no picture is available for now. It is a larger remnant of a leaf of manuscript D. The left side to the string hole and the bottom of the right side are missing (about 10 syllables each). Writing partly attrited.
There is one syllable missing in the metre after ñem.
The reading ks=allekomt stands for ksa allek komt according to 49 fn. 1.

list.item: a1 (Certainly) he sees there through long ages terrible, violent sufferings in hell. You, that do not have (the wish) to see these sufferings ... a2 hear the law with love [and] with [your] whole self. Look good at the one proclaiming the law, evoke the belief in him. [51d] At one time ... (the Buddha was in the Jeta-) a3 (vana). It was the son of the Śākyas, Hastaka by name, that had gone from the house to the Buddha. Without (having understood) them ... a4 (he evaded?) and made up a lie. He denied the decisions taken [saying]: Not I such (conversations?) ... a5 ... the virtuous Śākyas, (having forgotten) themselves, spoke lies. (Should we) not, because of their lie, renounce ... a6 (All monks, however), that went on their almsround, heard the Tīrthas’ talk [and] reported it to the Buddha. He summoned Hastaka ... a7 [53d] Hastaka said: I say [so], o shelter and refuge, the Tīrthas shall (not) prevail in this matter. Therefore I do not tell (a lie). The Omniscient (reprimanded) ... a8 ... the ragged clothes ... the one desiring extinction (my not tell) a lie. For he will eat carrion (?) .... b1 [54d] He takes the splendor from the teaching, (he does not) lead the community to fame, and increases even more the speaking (of blame) ... b2 the (monkish) virtues. If the monk (having gone) from the house for the sake of the truth loves the lying word, much (and) without (measure) ... b3 ... to be, he gives others the way. [55d] [A] good word one shall utter, never shall an evil word be uttered .... b4 [is] true, an evil word, once from the mouth (released), brings torture. This strophe he proclaimed to him .... b5 ... (Therefore) the one who has not practiced [moral conduct] must practice it. You also must in every manner turn always from the lie. [56d] ... b6 ... together with the group. May another man rise early, may he rub [his] body with ashes, (may he) day (and night) ... b7 ... (without) sacrifice I went over from evil [57c] [and] led the way to the Brahma-world. On the almsround the master went, the Omniscient ... [57d] ... b8 ... (And an evil word, even when released), one shall (not) utter again, the one releasing [it] is bound [thereby], since the noble ones do not utter it thus [in the thought:] it will be released by fools ...

Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
b8 It will have been uttered by fools. (cf [[TochSprR(B) I]]: ii, 32) 716

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1 (Bestimmt) sieht er dort durch lange Zeiten schreckliche, heftige Leiden in der Hölle. 194, fn. 1
a2 Höret das Gesetz mit Liebe [und] mit dem ganzen Selbst! Den das Gesetz Vortragenden sehet gut an [rufet] Glauben an ihn hervor! 331
a4 ... (wich er?) aus [und] machte sich eine Lüge zurecht. Er leugnete die gefassten Be-/Entschlüsse ab [mit den Worten]: "Nicht ich solche (Gespräche?) ..." 425, 442
b6 Mag ein anderer Mensch täglich schon früh aufstehen, mag er [sich] mit Asche den Körper abreiben, ... 326
b7 ... (ohne) Opfer wurde ich von dem Übel erlöst [und] führte mich(?) [ging(?)] den Weg zur Brahmawelt. 300
b8 (Und) [ein böses Wort], auch wenn [es] entlassen wurde, soll man (nicht) wieder von sich geben; der es Entlassende wird [dadurch] gebunden, denn die Edlen geben [es] nicht so von sich [in dem Gedanken]: "Es wird von Toren entlassen sein ...". 212

The glass cover of the manuscript is broken and thus no picture is available for now. It is a larger remnant of a leaf of manuscript D. The left side to the string hole and the bottom of the right side are missing (about 10 syllables each). Writing partly attrited.

Transcription

a4. Emendation according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 48 fn. 3.

a6. Emendations according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 48 fn. 4 and 5.

a7. Emendations according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 48 fn. 6 and 7.

b4. Emendation according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 48 fn. 10.

b5. Emendation according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 49 fn. 1.

b6. The reading ks=allekomt stands for ksa allek komt according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 49 fn. 1.

b8. Emendation according to [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 49 fn. 6.

General remarks

Includes strophes 51b-58b of the Vācāvarga (VIII) in a 4x25 syllable-metre (rhythm: 5/5/8/7). In b3-4 and b8, Uv 8.8-8.9 are translated.

Metre

a3. There is one syllable missing in the metre after ñem.

a1 /// ne walke preścyantsa emp·l[o]na a[k]watsana lkā_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ nrainne _l_aklenta : ket toy_m\ _l_aklenta lkātsi m[ā] /// a2 /// – – laikne _t_aṅkwsa pw āñmtsa _p_aklyauṣtso pelaikn= ākṣiṃ karttse palkas cewne persa_t\ takarṣkñe 50-1 sanai preśc·ai – /// a3 /// – skī_t_r_a • śakket_s\ soy ṣ[ai] ksa hastake ñe_m\ ostmeṃ ltu sū pudñäkteśca mā ton ai·[o] /// a4 /// t_r_a _p_as_t\ waike ārwer y· – t_r_a • _m_a_l_l_aṣṣi_t_ar sū eṅwa prati[nta] mā ñ[i]ś\ ··ā – [to] /// a5 /// krentaunacci ṣañ āñ_mä\ – – waike weskeṃ śakkeññi • mā cet_s\ waikesa pau[cc]iṃ /// a6 /// pintwā_t\ ynemane tī – – lyñe klyauṣāre ce_u pūdñäktentse [a]kṣāre • [ña] – – stakeṃ /// a7 /// ña hastake weskau saim wästa – – – s tu tīrthi yūkaṃ tusa [w]eskau mā – – – – ·s· – [po]yśi /// a8 /// ··e pāṃsukūl wastsi s·ā – – – [ks]ely[ñ]e ñäṣṣeñca waike – – – – mo śuwan no [ku] /// b1 /// – 4 [so]mpast_r_a peñyai śāsants· – – – m _k_alywene sāṅ_k_a _k_allā – – – [w]elyñe _ṣ_pak t_s_am_ṣ_aṃ • /// b2 /// ñana krentauna : empreṃtsñe_śc\ – – ·stmeṃ ṣamāne waike reki l[ā]r[e] – – – [lyap]o[ts]· snai /// b3 /// stsi_ś_aca yakne ai – – – ṅ_k_at_s\ 50-5 kre[ṃ]t tarkoy reki mantanta tark[o] – o[lain r]eki /// b4 /// ·mprentse yolo reki – – k[o]ynmeṃ _p_alśa_l_l_aññe _k_allā_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ : ce ślok akṣāne ·o /// b5 /// s= [a]pā_ṣ_ṣ_atte ālyi yām[ṣa] – ye_s_añ rano po klautkentsa ṣek waikemeṃ klautkolle 5 – – [ṣ]i /// b6 /// ṣe kraupempa : śaumo ks= allekom_t\ tsoṅkai_k\ tsaṅkoy ka taursa kektseñ kāntoy_t_a[r su kau] /// b7 /// lkanma ñiś\ yolaiññemeṃ [t_s_a]lpāwa brahmalo_k_aś tā_u ytāri śālamai pinwāt yeyo _k_aṣṣi poyśi /// b8 /// rkoṣ[n]e tarkoy ·o cau _t_a[r]·[nā]mane [śa]n_m_ast_r_a mā no _m_antrākka klyomoṃ _t_arkanaṃ _t_arkauw tākaṃ aknātsa ///
